plan.title: 30-Day Walk-a-Mile Challenge
plan.primaryGoal: Build a reliable daily habit of walking one mile with improving comfort, consistency, and pace.

targetOutcome.metric: Days with at least 1 mile walked

assumptions: You can safely perform low-impact walking (no current acute contraindicating injury).
You have 20–40 minutes available most days or can split walking into short segments.
You can access a safe walking route (sidewalk, track, treadmill, or indoor loop).
constraints: Weather or schedule may occasionally prevent outdoor walking.
Limited access to specialized equipment—plan for bodyweight-only walking.
Possible minor soreness; avoid pushing through sharp pain.
resources: Stopwatch or phone for timing and tracking
Water bottle and simple warm-up routine
Map of 1-mile routes (neighborhood, park, treadmill settings)
plan.purpose: Make walking one mile a dependable, energizing habit so it becomes effortless and sustainable beyond 30 days.
keyPrinciples: Start easy and progress gradually — consistency creates fitness.
Prioritize recovery and form over speed to avoid setbacks.
Track simple objective data (time, distance, notes) to build feedback loops.
Small, repeatable wins compound into a lasting habit.

riskHighlights.mitigation: Include warm-ups, cool-downs, one active recovery day per week, and reduce pace/distance if pain arises.
Plan walks into calendar, have 10–15 minute shorter options, and use 2 grace days in streakRule.
Vary route, add mini-challenges (tempo segments), pair with audio (podcast/music), and celebrate micro-wins.
Have indoor alternatives (mall, treadmill, hallway loops) and a weather-triggered quick plan.

milestones.title: First continuous mile
milestones.description: Walk one continuous mile comfortably without needing extended rests.

milestones.title: 3-day walking streak
milestones.description: Achieve a short streak of three consecutive days walking at least one mile.

milestones.title: Comfortable pace (≤18 min)
milestones.description: Walk one mile at or under an 18-minute time while feeling steady.

milestones.title: Mid-challenge consistency (12 walks)
milestones.description: Hit at least 12 logged one-mile walks by the midway point to prove habit formation.

milestones.title: Five-day streak & mini personal best
milestones.description: Complete a five-day streak and set a new comfortable fastest mile time.

milestones.title: Challenge complete: 25+ one-mile days
milestones.description: Finish strong with at least 25 days where you walked one mile in 30 days.

phases.name: Phase 1 — Start Moving (Days 1–7)
phases.objective: Establish the daily habit and complete your first continuous one-mile walk.

milestones.title: Plan your routes
milestones.detail: Identify 2–3 safe one-mile routes to use in the first week.

milestones.title: Complete first continuous mile
milestones.detail: Walk an unbroken mile by Day 7 at an easy pace.

risks.risk: Starting too fast and burning out
risks.mitigation: Keep pace conversational; split into 2 short breaks if needed and reduce pace.
Scout a safe route on Day 1 and have an indoor backup.
Log immediately after each walk; use a simple note or app.

phases.name: Phase 2 — Build the Streak (Days 8–14)
phases.objective: Turn single walks into short streaks and begin light pace work.

milestones.title: 3-day streak
milestones.detail: Stack three consecutive one-mile walks to build routine.

milestones.title: Introduce easy tempo intervals
milestones.detail: Add short periods of brisk walking into at least two walks.

risks.mitigation: Plan calendar blocks and have a 10–15 minute quick-walk fallback.
Use gentle mobility and one active recovery day.

phases.name: Phase 3 — Improve Comfort & Speed (Days 15–22)
phases.objective: Lower your mile time and deepen consistency toward midpoint goals.

milestones.title: Comfortable sub-18 minute mile
milestones.detail: Push to reach a steady mile in 18 minutes or less.

milestones.title: Mid-challenge consistency
milestones.detail: Accumulate at least 12 one-mile walks by Day 21.

risks.mitigation: Use interval training with short brisk segments, then recover fully.
Introduce variety (routes, music, partners) and small rewards.

phases.name: Phase 4 — Lock the Habit & Finish Strong (Days 23–30)
phases.objective: Convert runs into routine: extend streaks, chase a personal best, and hit 25+ days.

milestones.title: Five-day streak & mini PB
milestones.detail: Deliver five straight one-mile walks and record your fastest comfortable time.

milestones.title: Finish: 25+ one-mile days
milestones.detail: Close the challenge with at least 25 days logged in 30 days.

risks.mitigation: Use scheduled rest, lower intensity on taxing days, and rely on graceDays.
Keep PB attempts controlled and prioritize form and pain-free effort.

days.checkInPrompt: How motivated are you? (1–10)
days.celebrationMessage: You started — great momentum!

tasks.title: Choose 2 safe one-mile routes
tasks.details: Walk or map two nearby safe loops of approximately one mile; note start/end points.

tasks.title: Do a 5-minute dynamic warm-up
tasks.details: Perform leg swings, ankle circles, and knee lifts to prime your muscles.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile easy pace
tasks.details: Walk one mile at a conversational pace; stop briefly if needed but aim for continuity.

days.checkInPrompt: How did yesterday feel? Any tight spots?
days.celebrationMessage: Baseline set — you're on the board!

tasks.title: Check shoes and water
tasks.details: Confirm shoes feel good and bring water or a small snack.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile steady
tasks.details: Walk one full mile and note the time on your phone.

days.checkInPrompt: What time of day feels best for your walk?
days.celebrationMessage: Rhythm found — consistency building!

tasks.title: Short mobility routine
tasks.details: Spend 5–8 minutes on ankle, hip, and calf mobility before walking.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile and note pace
tasks.details: Walk one mile; try to keep a consistent cadence and record total time.

tasks.title: Log today's walk
tasks.details: Write one sentence about how the walk felt and the time you recorded.

days.checkInPrompt: Any soreness? Adjust pace if needed.
days.celebrationMessage: Day 4 — steady work!

tasks.title: Warm-up 5 minutes
tasks.details: Prime hips and calves with mobility and a short walk-in place.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile with two gentle pickups
tasks.details: During the mile, pick up the pace for 30–60 seconds twice, then recover.

days.checkInPrompt: What motivates you to finish today’s walk?
days.celebrationMessage: You tuned in and delivered — well done!

tasks.title: Route variation: pick a new path
tasks.details: Select a different one-mile route for mental freshness.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile relaxed
tasks.details: Focus on posture: tall chest, soft shoulders, even steps.

tasks.title: Recovery stretch 5 minutes
tasks.details: Do calf and hamstring stretches after walking.

days.checkInPrompt: Rate your energy (1–10). Match pace to energy.
days.celebrationMessage: Great effort — your habit is taking root!

tasks.title: Warm-up including brisk 1-minute walk
tasks.details: Add a single brisk minute to raise heart rate before the mile.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile aiming for steadier pace
tasks.details: Try to reduce your mile time slightly while staying comfortable.

tasks.title: Log time and energy
tasks.details: Note your mile time and how you felt (energy, breathing, effort).

days.checkInPrompt: Are you ready to complete your first continuous mile?
days.celebrationMessage: Milestone reached — your first continuous mile is done!

tasks.title: Prepare mentally and set route
tasks.details: Confirm route and set a realistic goal (continuous mile without sitting).

tasks.title: Walk one continuous mile
tasks.details: Walk a full mile without extended rests; keep a steady, comfortable pace.

tasks.title: Celebrate and note what worked
tasks.details: Record one thing that helped today and one adaptation for next week.

days.checkInPrompt: How will you protect your walk time today?
days.celebrationMessage: Day 8 — streak momentum continues!

tasks.title: Quick mobility warm-up
tasks.details: Loosen hips and calves for 5 minutes.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile steady
tasks.details: Complete a mile and focus on consistent effort.

tasks.title: Log streak count
tasks.details: Record that you completed another day toward your streak.

days.checkInPrompt: Can you add a small speed play today?
days.celebrationMessage: You added tempo — great feedback loop!

tasks.title: Warm-up with two 30-second brisk bursts
tasks.details: Include two short brisk bursts in your warm-up.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile with one 90-second brisk segment
tasks.details: Walk the mile and include a single 90-second brisk segment mid-mile.

tasks.title: Note perceived exertion
tasks.details: After the walk, rate effort and how pace felt.

days.checkInPrompt: What's your mini-goal for today (time/comfort)?
days.celebrationMessage: Three-day streak achieved — you’re building habit power!

tasks.title: Plan walk time and set reminder
tasks.details: Block a 30–40 minute slot and confirm your reminder.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile consistent pace
tasks.details: Complete the mile and focus on steady cadence.

tasks.title: Confirm 3-day streak in log
tasks.details: Mark your streak and how many consecutive days you’ve walked.

days.checkInPrompt: Any niggles? Favor recovery if needed.
days.celebrationMessage: Recovery day honored — that’s smart training.

tasks.title: Active recovery: 20-minute easy walk
tasks.details: Keep the pace gentle and enjoy relaxed breathing.

tasks.title: 5-minute post-walk mobility
tasks.details: Stretch calves and hips lightly after walking.

days.checkInPrompt: Ready to try two brisk segments today?
days.celebrationMessage: Tempo practice complete — you’re improving speed control!

tasks.title: Warm-up 7 minutes
tasks.details: Include dynamic mobility and two short brisk minutes.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile with two 60-second brisk picks
tasks.details: Insert two one-minute brisk walks; recover afterwards.

tasks.title: Record mile time and notes
tasks.details: Log time and note where the brisk segments felt strongest.

days.checkInPrompt: Can you hold a slightly faster pace while comfortable?
days.celebrationMessage: You practiced sustainable speed — great progress.

tasks.title: Warm-up and cadence check
tasks.details: Warm up and count steps for 30 seconds to check cadence.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile aiming for even splits
tasks.details: Try to keep each quarter-mile time similar; focus on steady effort.

days.checkInPrompt: What went well this week? What needs change?
days.celebrationMessage: Two weeks in — you’re building something reliable!

tasks.title: Active recovery walk 20 minutes
tasks.details: Keep it easy and breathe steady.

tasks.title: Weekly log: list 3 wins and 1 adaptation
tasks.details: Write down what worked this week and one change for next.

days.checkInPrompt: How close does 18 minutes feel today?
days.celebrationMessage: Mid-challenge — you’re stronger than day 1.

tasks.title: Warm-up with 2 brisk minutes
tasks.details: Raise heart rate briefly to prepare for a faster mile.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile aiming ≤18 minutes
tasks.details: Attempt to walk the mile near or under 18 minutes while staying controlled.

tasks.title: Record time and breathing effort
tasks.details: Log the exact time and note perceived exertion.

days.checkInPrompt: Where do you feel tension? Adjust posture.
days.celebrationMessage: Good form practice — small changes matter!

tasks.title: Posture drills 5 minutes
tasks.details: Practice tall posture, relaxed shoulders, and heel-to-toe walking.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile steady focusing on form
tasks.details: Keep attention on posture and smooth arm swing.

days.checkInPrompt: Can you try a new route or time?
days.celebrationMessage: Variety kept things fresh — nice job!

tasks.title: Pick a new one-mile route
tasks.details: Choose a different path or location for novelty.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile with one brisk 2-minute segment
tasks.details: Insert a 2-minute brisk walk to stimulate speed adaptation.

tasks.title: Log route and time
tasks.details: Note how the new route felt and your mile time.

days.checkInPrompt: Aim for a consistent faster mile today?
days.celebrationMessage: Tempo test complete — progress recorded!

tasks.title: Warm-up 7 minutes
tasks.details: Include dynamic movements and a brisk minute.

tasks.title: Attempt mile ≤18 minutes
tasks.details: Sustain a slightly faster pace and keep breathing steady.

tasks.title: Reflect on pacing
tasks.details: Write one note about pacing to use next tempo session.

days.checkInPrompt: How many walks have you logged so far?
days.celebrationMessage: Consistency stacking — keep logging!

tasks.title: Easy 20-minute walk
tasks.details: Keep it light and focus on breathing and recovery.

tasks.title: Update cumulative log count
tasks.details: Confirm total one-mile walks and note if you’re on track to 12 by Day 21.

days.checkInPrompt: Can you add one brisk minute to today’s mile?
days.celebrationMessage: Mini-challenge completed — nice push!

tasks.title: Warm-up with mobility
tasks.details: Prepare hips and ankles for slightly faster walking.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile with one 3-minute brisk segment
tasks.details: Include a 3-minute faster pace and recover afterward.

tasks.title: Log time and heart-rate feel
tasks.details: Note how the brisk segment affected your overall time.

days.checkInPrompt: Are you ready to hit the midpoint consistency goal?
days.celebrationMessage: Midpoint reached — 12 walks logged or close. Fantastic!

tasks.title: Review first 3 weeks' logs
tasks.details: Check total walks and identify the best day/route.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile steady and enjoy it
tasks.details: Complete the mile focusing on rhythm and breathing.

tasks.title: Plan next week’s targets
tasks.details: Set one concrete goal for next week (streak/pb/route).

days.checkInPrompt: Which walk felt strongest so far?
days.celebrationMessage: You honored recovery — smart habit building.

tasks.title: Active recovery walk 20 minutes
tasks.details: Keep it easy and breathe deeply.

tasks.title: Short mobility and foam roll 10 minutes
tasks.details: Target calves, quads, and hips to reduce stiffness.

days.checkInPrompt: Can you commit to five days in a row?
days.celebrationMessage: You launched the final push — stay focused!

tasks.title: Set a 5-day streak schedule
tasks.details: Block the next five days in your calendar and set reminders.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile with intention
tasks.details: Complete the mile focusing on controlled pace.

days.checkInPrompt: Ready to try intervals today?
days.celebrationMessage: Speed work done — you’re sharpening your pace!

tasks.title: Warm-up with 3 brisk minutes
tasks.details: Include short brisk intervals to prime speed.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile with 3 x 1-minute brisk repeats
tasks.details: Insert three one-minute brisk walks with recovery between.

tasks.title: Note any pace improvement
tasks.details: Record if the repeats lowered your overall mile time.

days.checkInPrompt: Aim to beat your best comfortable mile today?
days.celebrationMessage: Mini PB achieved or attempted — celebrate the effort!

tasks.title: Thorough warm-up 10 minutes
tasks.details: Warm up fully to prepare for a controlled fast mile attempt.

tasks.title: Attempt a comfortable personal best mile
tasks.details: Walk a mile aiming for your fastest sustainable pace while staying pain-free.

tasks.title: Log PB and recovery plan
tasks.details: Record the time and plan a gentle recovery walk or rest.

days.checkInPrompt: How does your body feel after the PB attempt?
days.celebrationMessage: You sustained the effort and cared for recovery — excellent work.

tasks.title: Active recovery walk 20 minutes
tasks.details: Keep it easy to flush legs and aid recovery.

tasks.title: Short mobility and hydration routine
tasks.details: Hydrate and spend 10 minutes on mobility and foam rolling.

days.checkInPrompt: How many walks left to hit 25 days?
days.celebrationMessage: You’re weeks of habit away from the finish line — keep it up!

tasks.title: Plan final 3–4 walks
tasks.details: Schedule the remaining walks needed to reach 25+ days.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile steady pace
tasks.details: Complete the mile focusing on relaxed, efficient walking.

tasks.title: Update cumulative progress
tasks.details: Record the total number of one-mile walks to date.

days.checkInPrompt: What small ritual will get you out the door today?
days.celebrationMessage: Final push underway — you're nearly there!

tasks.title: Short warm-up
tasks.details: Prime your body with mobility and a brisk minute.

tasks.title: Walk 1 mile and savor it
tasks.details: Enjoy the environment and steady breathing as you complete the mile.

days.checkInPrompt: Which walk this month felt best and why?
days.celebrationMessage: Reflection day — you’re preparing to finish strong.

tasks.title: Easy 20-minute walk
tasks.details: Keep it relaxed to conserve energy for the final day.

tasks.title: Write 3 takeaways from the challenge
tasks.details: Note habits to keep and one change to make long-term.

days.checkInPrompt: Are you ready to seal the challenge with a final mile?
days.celebrationMessage: You did it — 30 days of commitment. Celebrate your new habit!

tasks.title: Prepare celebratory routine
tasks.details: Choose a celebratory cool-down and a small reward for after the walk.

tasks.title: Complete your final one-mile walk
tasks.details: Walk the mile with intention, reflect on your journey, and savor the finish.

tasks.title: Finalize log: confirm 25+ days and next steps
tasks.details: Ensure you have at least 25 one-mile days logged and set a maintenance plan.

reflectionQuestions: Which time of day felt best for walking?
Did you face any barriers to completing a mile?
What small adjustment made the walk easier?

adaptationRules.condition: If average daily time > planned window
adaptationRules.response: Shorten warm-up or split the mile into two shorter segments to fit schedule.

adaptationRules.condition: If pain or sharp discomfort reported
adaptationRules.response: Pause pace increases, schedule an extra recovery day and consult a professional if persistent.
Reset with a 10–15 minute quick-walk plan and re-block walk times into calendar.

reflectionQuestions: Are you recovering well between walks?

adaptationRules.response: Reduce brisk segment duration or frequency and focus on form.
Introduce a new route, podcast, or walking partner for variety.
Implement 10–15 minute backup walks or split the mile into two shorter walks.

reflectionQuestions: Have your mile times improved? By how much?
Is the habit integrating into daily routines?

adaptationRules.response: Add one targeted interval session and ensure two recovery sessions that week.
Schedule an extra active recovery day and reduce interval intensity.

adaptationRules.condition: If log shows <12 walks by Day 21
adaptationRules.response: Prioritize short morning or evening walks to catch up and use reminders.

reflectionQuestions: Did you hit the 25+ day target?
What will you keep from this routine?
How will you maintain progress after day 30?

adaptationRules.response: Plan back-to-back short walks to reach 25 before Day 30 and prioritize easy wins.
Scale back to walking every other day with cross-training and consult care if needed.
Set a new maintenance target (e.g., 3–5 miles/week) and plan reward rituals.

reminderRule.message: Today’s walk: one mile. Lace up and move.

celebrationRule.message: Nice work — you completed today's mile! Log it and breathe.

plan.callToAction: Step up: 1 mile a day — commit for 30!
